rule: Suffixes adding s and es to form plurals
subrule: Suffix: The part added to the end of the base word.  It can change the meaning or part of speech of the word.
advice: To make most nouns plural, you add -s to the end of the word.  If a word ends in -ch, -s, -x. amd -sh (and sometimes -o), you usually add -es to form the plural of the word.
